p: Malaria is a notorious disease and one of the main causes of high morbidity and mortality in many tropical and subtropical areas. The ethnopharmacological relevance of the Bergenia species for treating fever has been time-tested. EtOH leaf extracts B. ciliata (ELEBC) has been tested for its antiplasmodial ( Plasmodium berghei) activity using a rodent-malaria model, along with chloroquine (10 μM) as a positive control. The IC 50 of ELEBC was found to be less than 10 μg/mL. Thus, both the in vitro and in vivo experiments have confirmed the antimalarial activity of ELEBC [ 43].
